title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 252.4 - Initial processing by director
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 252.4 - Initial processing by director

State Regulations
(a) Initial review. After a
charge is filed, the director of PEPR shall conduct a review of the charge to
determine whether the facts as alleged may constitute an unfair labor practice
as set forth in section 704 or 704-a of SERA. If the director of PEPR
determines that the facts as alleged do not, as a matter of law, constitute a
violation, the director of PEPR may dismiss the charge, with a written
explanation, subject to review by the board under Section
253.22
of this Chapter; alternatively, the director of PEPR may permit the party to amend the charge to
cure such deficiency in the charge. If the deficiency is not cured, the
director of PEPR may dismiss the charge with a written explanation of the
grounds for the dismissal or deem the charge, or any part thereof, withdrawn. Such dismissal is likewise subject to review of the board under Section
253.22
of this Chapter. (b) Notice of conference. A
notice of conference pursuant to Section
253.10
of this Chapter shall be
prepared by the director of PEPR or a designated hearing officer specifying the
time and place for the conference and, together with a copy of the charge, shall be delivered to the charging party and each named respondent. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
252.4

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
